section.title: Optimize
section.para: This tutorial was started from the default settings in the June 9, 2008 build of GMAT.

section.title: Overview
section.para: The optimize command in GMAT allows variables to optimize by using a solver fmincon object.

listitem.para: Must set in order to use Optimize Command.
Must be defined if you would like to minimize variable in an optimize sequence.

section.title: Using the GUI
section.para: The Optimize dialog contains only solver user can selected. Also, in optimize sequence user can give some commands.

listitem.para: Must select solver applying for optimize sequence

info.title: Figure: Default Optimize Command Dialog Box without setting fmincon

caption.para: Figure: Default Optimize Command Dialog Box without setting fmincon

entry.para: The SolverName field allows the user to choose between any previously created optimizer for use in an optimization sequence. For example, to begin a optimization sequence using DefaultSQP, the script is Optimize DefaultSQP.
Options: { Any non-targeter and non-optimizer command lines used in the mission sequence, as well as the optimizer dependent command lines Vary, NonLinearConstraint, and Minimize. }
